items.content:
TicketFlash App

Lead Full Stack Developer

You’ve worked as a freelance or in an agency,  and you have built or contributed to a few different projects and can demonstrate that. We believe tickets should be transactable, that means fully shareable and returnable. Want to join us in wrestling control from the touts? Read on… You’ll be working on: * Our backend platform, written in .NET Framework 4.5 with a SQL Server database (we’d like to update this to .NET Core 2.2). * Our iOS app, written in Swift * Our event door app, written in JavaScript and the Electron framework * Developing or delivering our new Android app, ideally to be built in Xamarin, but we're open to suggestions * Developing the analytical tools to understand ticket buyer behaviour in detail. * Expanding and developing app features including geolocational security and last-minute activation of tickets. We hope that you will: * Have experience with at least some of the technologies we’ve mentioned above (iOS Development with Swift, .NET & ASP.NET, JavaScript, Android Development, and Azure). * Have some public evidence of what you know. Do you have a stackoverflow profile? A hacker news profile? Do you tweet? Write about technical things on Medium? Contribute to open source in any way? * At least 3 years of professional experience * Live somewhere in Great Britain or Ireland and can make it to Birmingham occasionally. * Have lots of ideas and a willingness to share them! We’re a startup so things can be chaotic. As well as being able to write good, clean code you’ll need to be able to solve problems on a daily basis using your own initiative. Flexibility and resilience are key! If you’re smart, friendly and love building software—we want to hear from you. Us We’ve boot-strapped the beta version with the help of contractors – so we’re in the scrappy early stages. The role will initially be on a part-time, contract basis. We're raising a round, we'll make you full time and pay you a full-time salary when we do.  As a key partner, you'll get a generous share option package from the start to reflect your time and commitment in the fundraising. Where you’ll work Although we’re based in Birmingham and will need to see you in person from time to time, you can work remotely the rest of the time.

items.title: Peerfit: Android Engineer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=1, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=26, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=8, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Android Engineer

Peerfit
Interested in working for a team of people completely redefining how fitness and health care work together? At Peerfit, we’re flipping wellness reimbursements on their head by connecting insurers’ and employers’ wellness dollars to popular fitness studios offering CrossFit, yoga, barre, boot camp, cycling, and more. If working with a team of innovative and driven people who are modernizing how people engage with wellness excites you, look no further than Peerfit.


POSITION SUMMARY:
As an Android engineer you will be joining the Client Development team in support of continued development of Peerfit's native mobile experience. You will participate in feature development across different cross-functional teams, help represent mobile in client-driven API negotiation, and support our infrastructure engineer in maturing the mobile tooling for CI and operations. You'll be working with an established team of Android developers.

We're seeking someone who is solution-oriented, pragmatic, and consensus-driven in their approach to rapidly building iterative software that solves real problems in our product and technical domains.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
You will be responsible for managing our native Android app implemented with Kotlin and min. SDK 21 and act as a representative for native client development. You will collaborate with client peers using pair programming, code review, testing, and team-driven continuous improvement. You will also work with Design and Marketing to help translate product and marketing objectives into idiomatic Android experiences.

EXPERIENCE/QUALIFICATIONS:
  • Bachelor’s degree in an information/comp-sci program or the equivalent combination of education, training, or work experience.
  • 1-7 years of professional experience delivering native Android apps; knowledge and experience using Kotlin
  • Experience with writing unit / functional tests
  • Experience with Git and GitFlow
  • Experience creating Android libraries
  • Experience with design patterns


NICE TO HAVES:
  • Comfort with open source tooling including bash, vim, tmux
  • Experience with Docker, Kubernetes, and/or Google Cloud infrastructure technologies
  • Experience with Fastlane


WHO WE NEED: (Intangibles) 
  • Passionate about health and fitness
  • Desires to have a role in the growth of a startup 
  • Stays motivated and knows how to be persistent
  • Is self-directed
  • Can work remotely and make decisions autonomously at a high level
  • Flexibility to handle changing responsibilities


WHAT YOU GET:
  • The opportunity to help expand the impact of Peerfit across the United States…and, someday, the world!
  • The chance to work in a relaxed, yet goal-driven start-up culture with a passion for fitness
  • Peerfit credits to attend fitness classes.
  • Chance to work remotely with flexible scheduling
  • Health Insurance & other benefits


Peerfit is an Equal Opportunity Employer

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=54, c=2, mobile=42, go=0, nodejs=11, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=21, java=2, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=3}
items.content:
Lead Full Stack Developer

About this job

Job type: Contract
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Role: Full Stack Developer, Mobile Developer
Industry: Enterprise Software, Events, Ticketing
Company size: 1–10 people
Company type: Private
Company: TicketFlash App | No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT+00:00) London

Technologies

csharp
asp.net
javascript
ios
swift

Job description

You’ve worked as a freelance or in an agency,  and you have built or contributed to a few different projects and can demonstrate that.

We believe tickets should be transactable, that means fully shareable and returnable. Want to join us in wrestling control from the touts? Read on…

You’ll be working on:

  • Our backend platform, written in .NET Framework 4.5 with a SQL Server database (we’d like to update this to .NET Core 2.2).
  • Our iOS app, written in Swift
  • Our event door app, written in JavaScript and the Electron framework
  • Developing or delivering our new Android app, ideally to be built in Xamarin, but we're open to suggestions
  • Developing the analytical tools to understand ticket buyer behaviour in detail.
  • Expanding and developing app features including geolocational security and last-minute activation of tickets.

We hope that you will:

  • Have experience with at least some of the technologies we’ve mentioned above (iOS Development with Swift, .NET & ASP.NET, JavaScript, Android Development, and Azure).
  • Have some public evidence of what you know. Do you have a stackoverflow profile? A hacker news profile? Do you tweet? Write about technical things on Medium? Contribute to open source in any way?
  • At least 3 years of professional experience
  • Live somewhere in Great Britain or Ireland and can make it to Birmingham occasionally.
  • Have lots of ideas and a willingness to share them!

We’re a startup so things can be chaotic. As well as being able to write good, clean code you’ll need to be able to solve problems on a daily basis using your own initiative. Flexibility and resilience are key!

If you’re smart, friendly and love building software—we want to hear from you.

Us

We’ve boot-strapped the beta version with the help of contractors – so we’re in the scrappy early stages.

The role will initially be on a part-time, contract basis. We're raising a round, we'll make you full time and pay you a full-time salary when we do. 

As a key partner, you'll get a generous share option package from the start to reflect your time and commitment in the fundraising.

Where you’ll work

Although we’re based in Birmingham and will need to see you in person from time to time, you can work remotely the rest of the time.

Apply now

About TicketFlash App

Ticketflash is a mobile ticketing company. Our mission is to deliver transactable tickets that are fully shareable and returnable. We aim to create a more transparent market to squeeze out touts, challenge the secondary market and improve the whole ticket buying and ticket-holding experience.

We're pre-revenue so the budget is limited. But the beta is ready and the business plan is written. And you’ll be working with a founder who has raised an A-round of £300k for an earlier project.

Benefits

  • Flexible & remote working
  • Great startup working environment
  • Early stage, so open to best practice, new & different technologies
  • Intriguing challenge to take on ticket touts

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=8, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=30, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=6, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Join our cross-functional team and your work will involve more than coding for coding’s sake; the apps we produce make a difference to people’s lives and our culture encourages and embraces individual and team contributions as part of an “ideas meritocracy”. Quality Compliance Systems Ltd (QCS) is a fast-growing saas with a clear market leading position in the UK Care sector. 


The Android Mobile Application Developer is responsible for the creation of high-quality, industry leading Mobile Applications for QCS clients.  Constantly seeking to learn and improve they actively research, develop and recommend practices, platforms, features and best practice that may benefit QCS and our clients.


The Opportunity: 



  • Building state of the art mobile apps for a rapidly growing user base.

  • Maintain and enhance mobile applications by addressing bugs and introducing new features

  • Strong focus on technical quality standards.

  • Demonstrate new features to colleagues prior to release.

  • Contribute throughout the software development life cycle.

  • Thorough understanding of modern development practices such as test automation, Cloud centric apps, CI/CD and DevOps.

  • Diligent and self-motivated part of a small mobile development team.

  • Experienced in working with a strong backend development team to deliver functionality.

  • Interacting with UI / UX designers to achieve an aspirational UX which is suitable for our clients.

  • Participating in pull requests and code reviews.

  • Regularly assessing and improving anything that affects you, your team or the company.

  • Proactively research development practices, products and mobile devices to recommend, research and develop valuable features


Skills & experience required:



  • Successful delivery of at least 3 applications on Android OS (mobile and/or tablet).

  • Full understanding of the Software Delivery Lifecycle.

  • Demonstrates a strong understanding and experience of working with the Android SDK, Kotlin and Android Studio.

  • Understanding of at least one other programming language (Nice to have).

  • Strong understanding of secure coding practices.

  • Able to contribute to the design of REST APIs.

  • Mastery of object-oriented programming paradigms – You should be familiar with SOLID and GRASP principles and know that the Hollywood Principle is not screening at the cinema anytime soon.   

  • Understanding of design patterns and the principles of software architecture.

  • Versed in version control and Agile Lifecycle Management (ALM) tools - Ideally Git and Azure DevOps.

  • Experience of working with Fabric (Answers, Crashlytics, Twitter), Google Analytics, Firebase, Google SDK, Localisations and Push Notifications.

  • Experienced in test automation, continuous integration and continuous deployment.

  • Understanding of Human Interface Guidelines.

  • Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, and confident when dealing with colleagues and customers.  

  • Experience of working as part of small development team.

  • Experience of working with remote/offshore developers and testers.

  • You should be a lifelong learner who is passionate about technology.

  • You should possess strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

  • Familiar with at least one Agile methodology - preferably Scrum. 


Benefits include pension, Perkbox employee rewards (childcare vouchers, cycle to work plus dining, shopping and entertainment discounts), parking paid and local gym membership.


We encourage remote working and flexibility with core hours.


No agencies please.

Mobile Chapter Lead Front-End (m/f/d)

Company: Raisin
Location: Berlin, DE
Level: Senior
Language: English
Mobile Apps Developer
Skills:
  • Android
  • iOS
  • Mobile Architecture
  • Mobile Web Design
  • React
  • React Native
  • Team Leadership

    • Intro

    We are a dynamic, successful, and fast growing FinTech company based in Berlin, that aims to making savings and investments digitally accessible to improve customer benefit. Our goal is to provide customers all over Europe with simple, secure, and profitable savings and investment products without barriers. We have received more than €195 million in funding from well-known investors including Thrive Capital, Ribbit Capital, Index Ventures, Yuri Milner, Tom Stafford and PayPal.
    Raisin has been very successful over the last few years at delighting it’s customers through enabling deposits and investments without barriers across the EU. 

    Your mission as an experienced Leader & React Native Developer is to enable teams to build great solutions with delighting UI’s and an amazing mobile user experience. Increasing the engagement of existing customers and winning over new customer groups and market segments are amongst the key objectives.

    Your Responsibilities:

    • You are Chapter lead, with accountability for the improvement of our overall mobile engineering capability, including talent, workflows and tools
    • You are Key contributor in a cross-functional mobile team
    • You are a hands-on team lead and mentor
    • You ensure a high working morale, teamspirit, and productivity
    • You develop both your chapter’s soft- and technical skill-set according to the company goals and needs
    • You coach your chapter to remove obstacles independently, but you also get your hands dirty, when needed
    • You are a role model and inspire your chapter to live our principles of customer-centric innovation, entrepreneurship and responsibility
    • You are a key contributor to an efficient development environment and optimal workflows for the whole engineering organization
    • You are a great communicator and empathetic motivator when needed 

    Main requirements

     Your Profile:

    • You bring at least 3 years of leadership experience
    • You know how to manage software projects to a successful delivery in a collaborative way
    • Entrepreneurial mindset and the ability to guide teams towards a common goal in a fast-paced international environment
    • You have strong experience (3y)  with React Native / Redux and have a portfolio of nice examples that showcases your experience
    • You have a deep understanding of the app integration and delivery lifecycle, including code signing and app store reviews
    • You are an open-minded and creative team player enjoying constructive code and architecture discussions
    • Writing clean, maintainable and well-documented code comes naturally - we strongly believe in the power of clean code
    • Android (Java) and/or iOS (Swift) experience is a plus
    • Fluency in English, German language skills are a plus though not mandatory 

     

    Our Benefits:

    Be part of a diverse team of more than 34 different nationalities, who strongly believes in agile cross-functional methods, collaboration and appreciation in our daily work. We are professional and work hard to always be the best in our field. You find us in our open office in beautiful Prenzlauer Berg well connected to public transport and surrounded by a great variety of restaurants and supermarkets.

    • Relocation and visa support as well as a relocation reimbursement
    • Personal training budget of 1,700 € and four full training days
    • Free choice of hardware
    • Beginner German classes directly at the office and financial support for acquiring a language certificate 
    • Hungry all the time? Breakfast, snacks, daily fresh fruit as well as drinks are provided
    • Stay up to date at regular townhall sessions with our founders and feel free to ask any kinds of questions
    • Flexible working hours, home office and 28 vacation days 
    • Enjoy more than 50+ different sports with Urban Sports Club: We subsidize your membership with more than 20 € per month 
    • We offer you a company pension scheme (Betriebliche Altersvorsorge), which we support with 20 %
    • Enjoy yearly company retreats to exciting European cities and other team events, such as Lunch Lottery, Tech Lunch, Xletix and Raisin Ladies Events

items.content:
Kotlin Developer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Mobile Developer
Industry: Mobile, Product Development, Web Development
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: Private
Company: eyeo GmbH | Cologne, Germany

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT+01:00) Berlin +/- 2 hours
Office Location: Cologne, Germany. Employees can also work full time from this office.
Relocation Assistance: Yes

Technologies

kotlin
kotlin-android-extensions
chromium
c++
java

Job description

Get to know us

We create open source software that puts users in control over their online browsing experience. Our desktop and mobile products, such as Adblock Plus, Adblock Browser and Flattr, help sustain and grow a fair, open web, because they give users control while providing user-friendly monetization. Our most popular product, Adblock Plus (ABP), is currently used on over 100 million devices.

What you’ll do

Work on Android SDK, LibAdblockPlus and chromium integration.

After your morning coffee, you’ll be expected to...

  • Develop Adblock Plus SDK and its integration using your Java/Kotlin, JavaScript and C++ skills
  • Solve problems such as optimizing memory usage and performance for our mobile partners, and of course striving for a high adblocking quality
  • Ensure the stability of our SDKs across all platforms and partners
  • Ensure that partner requests are answered and implemented, and that partners are satisfied
  • Keep up with changes related to Chromium versions and translate these into the required changes for our libraries
  • Work with other team members for code reviews and coordination of QA

What you bring:

  • 4+ years of software development experience
  • Ability to solve compatibility problems using Kotlin, Java, C++, JavaScript and Python
  • Understanding of how the web technically works
  • Comprehensive knowledge of the Android SDK and OS
  • Experience working with complex software projects
  • Experience with concurrency/multithreaded development (both C++ and Java/Kotlin)
  • Experience with Building Systems (e.g. GNU make, gradle)
  • Experience of cross platform native development (Android, iOS, Linux)
  • Experience of UI and Unit-testing for Android
  • Knowledge of version control systems (git)
  • Fluent in both verbal and written English
  • Proactive problem solver with a good attitude

It’s awesome, but not required, if you have...

  • Knowledge about Java or other programming languages
  • Experience working on open source projects
  • Understanding of the ad tech landscape
  • The ability to speak Mandarin (not at all required, but would be amazing)

A little bit about the team you’ll work with

The Distribution Partners team works on growing eyeo’s number of users by finding and collaborating with partners that help us scale our user base. Our partners include leading players in the browser and OEM markets; we collaborate closely with them to integrate ad-blocking technologies into their projects. We do this by providing, maintaining, and constantly updating the SDKs that make it easy for our partners to integrate with us. We add features and functionality based on partner feedback and new trends in the markets around us.

Not sure if this is for you? Consider contributing first. 

When applying, please include a code sample or, preferably, references to open source projects you’ve worked on.

Apply now

About eyeo GmbH

At eyeo we create software that puts users in control of their online browsing experience. Our products, including Adblock Plus, Adblock Browser, Flattr, and Trusted News, help sustain and grow a fair, profitable and open web, while providing user-friendly monetization for publishers and advertisers. Our most popular product, Adblock Plus, is used on more than 100 million active devices worldwide.

Founded in Cologne, Germany in 2011, eyeo currently employs a team of more than 150 specialists in development, data science, business development, design and PR, with satellite offices in Berlin and Malmö, and remote workers in the US, Nigeria, Canada and across Europe.

Benefits

  • Choose Your Own Hardware & Software
  • Flexible Working Hours (you choose when you start work)
  • Home Office & Remote Work
  • Subway Ticket (Travel for free in Cologne or Berlin)
  • Diverse International Team
  • Games! (foosball, flipper, ping-pong, PS4 & VR-games provided)
  • Paid Relocation (we support your move to Germany in any way we can)
  • Free Drinks, Barista Station (make your own cappuccino) & Fruits

items.content: Welligent, a fast-growing Electronic Health Record (EHR) software vendor based in Norfolk, is seeking an experienced mobile application developer to develop and support custom-developed Welligent apps. A leading national software vendor, Welligent provides a comprehensive, enterprise cloud-based software solution which comprises practice management, clinical, billing and reporting functions. Ancillary to its cloud-based solutions, Welligent also offers mobile apps which offer a sub-set of functionality or complementary functionality to our cloud-based solutions. Welligent's customers include community-based behavioral/health and human services providers in more than 30 states. Our company culture and environment has the excitement of a start-up with the intensity of a growing healthcare information technology company solving national issues. There is a pervasive sense that the work we do is making a big impact in the lives of our customers and those they serve.Job Duties Serve as the primary app developer and responsible for app design and UI, all development, testing, debugging and on-going enhancements Lead Welligent's mobile development initiatives as the primary app developer and grow Welligent's mobile practice area Responsible for the ongoing evolution of our existing mobile apps, to enhance functionality and provide a better experience for end users Working within our existing application frameworks, provide creative input, expertise and technical methods Make a significant impact by working directly with the company and product owners, developers and other team members to improve upon an existing strong enterprise application with an extensive national user base Work with the business users to understand and document functionality requirements Collaborate with other technical team members including Welligent's web-services team to understand/ensure data requirements are met As needed, perform business and data requirements gathering and data analysis tasks Identify and document relevant data design, process and specifications Willingness to understand business context and problems and communicate them clearly in written and oral format Requirements Bachelor's degree required Advanced knowledge/experience with Angular with Javascript Advanced knowledge/experience with Cordova and plugins Knowledge of jQuery, Ionic, FullCalendar framework Must be familiar with PouchDB integration for SQLite Experience with SQLite offline storage Basic knowledge of TypeScript Basic knowledge of C++ for comping Windows package Must be familiar with NodeJs package manager PHP (must be familiar with curl basic authentications) Data encryption - AES, Hash NodeJs, must be familiar with package manager using the command line Sass (a plus but not needed since UI already built) User interface design and front end development experience Knowledge of HTML, DHTML, CSS and JavaScript Experience with Android Studio, Xcode/Swift, Visual Studio Experience with Apple, Google, and Microsoft store submission process and knowledge of creating and publishing provisioning profiles and certificates for all platforms. Must be familiar with HTTP services Some knowledge of Red Hat Linux server, basic knowledge of command line connection using SSH Knowledge of relational database design Ability to work independently and solve complex software problems Strong analytical and problem solving skills Knowledge of Healthcare IT, EHR/EMR or clinical systems preferred Experience working in a small team to build and enhance complex enterprise software applications Green card or US Citizenship required BenefitsIn addition to health, dental and 401K benefits, Welligent's competitive perks and benefits include the potential for year-end bonus, flexible work schedule, casual office environment in an up-and-coming area of Norfolk near Old Dominion University, no dress code, Starbucks coffee and an amazing group of co-workers.

items.content:
Senior iOS Engineer // Idagio

Company: Idagio

Tags:
  • streaming
  • Development
  • Engineering
  • music streaming
  • iOS development
  • Swift
  • subscription-based

    • We are looking for an experienced iOS developer to join our marvelous Mobile team: a group of people with a shared interest in great user experience, robust software, fast delivery, and clear communication.

    Help us build our native iOS app, giving our listeners easy access to the most comprehensive catalogue of classical music in streaming. As part of a cross-functional team, you will be actively involved in all stages of the development process, collaborating closely with designers, product managers, and other teams.

    Come build the best classical music streaming service with us!

    Your Role & Responsibilities

    • Develop new features
    • Enhance and maintain our existing Swift codebase
    • Ensure great quality and user experience
    • Be part of a cross-functional team consisting of product managers, designers, and engineers
    • Take part in all stages of the development process
    • Mentor other developers

    Relevant experience and personality traits

    • Pragmatism and a solution-oriented attitude
    • Clarity, openness, and enthusiasm in communication with colleagues across domains
    • Familiarity with Swift and the iOS ecosystem
    • Solid knowledge of software architecture and object-oriented design
    • Ability to handle large projects end-to-end
    • Experience with Automated Testing and Continuous Integration
    • Passion for clean code and maintainability
    • Experience using Interface Builder and Autolayout
    • Fluency in English

    Nice to have

    • Multiple apps available in the AppStore
    • Leadership experience
    • Open Source Software contributions
    • A background in classical music

    What we have to offer

    • International team with diverse backgrounds and extensive experience in both classical music and digital products.
    • A friendly and purpose-driven working atmosphere in our office in Berlin Kreuzberg.
    • Directly contribute to the success of our evolving product.
    • Flexible working hours, occasional remote work and your choice of hardware and tools.
    • Competitive salary and collaborative environment.
    • We value long-lasting relationships – we provide a yearly education budget to make sure you develop and grow within your role.
    Apply for this position
